snippet: Election specialists said the move, involving Evergreen, was the first since the Supreme Court struck down part of the Voting Rights Act in June.
abstract: Judge Callie V S Granade of Federal District Court in Mobile, Ala, reinstates federal oversight over voting practices of city of Evergreen in what election specialists say is first such move since US Supreme Court struck down part of Voting Rights Act in June; judge uses mechanism in law that Supreme Court had left untouched, allowing jurisdictions that have intentionally discriminated against minority voters to be pulled into oversight requirements.
lead_paragraph: Election specialists said the move, involving Evergreen, was the first since the Supreme Court struck down part of the Voting Rights Act in June.

headline.main: Judge Reinstates Some Federal Oversight of Voting Practices for an Alabama City
headline.print_headline: Judge Reinstates Some Federal Oversight of Voting Practices for an Alabama City
